channel.title: Comments on: Google Apps First Impressions

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>According to Google Help, the maximum message size is 10mb which means that attachments can be up to 10mb depending upon the size of the rest of the message: { <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://mail.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?answer=8770&topic=1517"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://mail.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?answer=8770&topic=1517"</a> rel="nofollow" target ="blank">Link</a> }</p>
item.content:encoded: According to Google Help, the maximum message size is 10mb which means that attachments can be up to 10mb depending upon the size of the rest of the message: { http://mail.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?answer=8770&topic=1517“ rel=”nofollow” target =”blank”>Link }

item.title: By: Stephen Hood
item.dc:creator: Stephen Hood
item.description: <p>My Notes mail file was around 5GB after 8 years before I did a bit of archiving. And as a QA manager I used to receive lots of screen-shots, attachments, documents (some substantial)...so 10GB is really A LOT.<br /><br />Any idea what the maximum attachment/message size is?</p>
item.content:encoded:
My Notes mail file was around 5GB after 8 years before I did a bit of archiving. And as a QA manager I used to receive lots of screen-shots, attachments, documents (some substantial)…so 10GB is really A LOT.

Any idea what the maximum attachment/message size is?
